subject: Critical Thinking
title: Confirmation Bias: Seeing What You Already Believe
description: A short lesson to help you apply Confirmation Bias: Seeing What You Already Believe.

hook.text: You search Google for 'coffee is healthy.' You find 50 studies confirming it. Search over. Bias complete.

buildup.text: Confirmation bias: we seek, notice, and remember evidence that supports what we already believe.

discovery.text: Peter Wason proved it in 1960. People tested rules by looking for confirming cases â€” almost never disconfirming ones.

twist.text: Social media amplifies it exponentially. Algorithms feed you content you agree with â€” a bias machine.

climax.text: The antidote: actively seek evidence against your belief. If it survives, your belief is stronger.

punchline.text: The strongest beliefs are the ones that survived attack.

quiz.question: What is confirmation bias?
options: Seeking and favoring evidence that supports existing beliefs
